com.habitsoft.kiyaa.metamodel
Interface ModelCollection<T>

public interface ModelCollection<T>

Collection-like class meant for use in in the display system. This interface takes into account that the collection is often, but not always, backed by a web service which must be accessed asynchronously, and that the collection is sometimes much larger than what you really want to display. Many common collection operations are omitted because they are potentially expensive.

Method Summary
 Object getId()
          Return a long value indicating the underlying ID used to load this collection.
 void getLength(com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<Integer> callback)
          Fetch the total number of items in the collection; returns null if the total is not known or if the collection has unbounded size.
 void load(int offset, int limit, com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<T[]> callback)
          Access part of the collection; accesses to the collection are assumed to be paged.
 

Method Detail

getId

Object getId()
Return a long value indicating the underlying ID used to load this collection. This is used by collection views to decide whether to reload fully, or just update incrementally.

getLength

void getLength(com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<Integer> callback)
Fetch the total number of items in the collection; returns null if the total is not known or if the collection has unbounded size. This is used to determine whether the current page is the last page.

load

void load(int offset,
          int limit,
          com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.AsyncCallback<T[]> callback)
Access part of the collection; accesses to the collection are assumed to be paged. After all, who would be crazy enough to view the entire collection at once? There a possibility when paging through the data that objects will be inserted into the middle of the "offset" space, in which case an item could be returned twice or never. The caller should not assume that this won't happen. The callback is passed an array of model objects. (Object[])
